title: Missing Odisha woman constable found murdered in Keonjhar
content: Deceased Subhamitra Sahoo, a native of Paradip in Jagatsinghpur district and posted in Bhubaneswar, disappeared after leaving home for duty on September 6, police said.

title: High price of gold, oil reason for Kerala’s high retail inflation rate, says Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal
content: The inflation rate in Kerala stood at 9.04%, the highest among major States, according to the year-on-year inflation rate based on the all-India Consumer Price Index for the month of August

title: Ramadoss, estranged son Anbumani pay separate tributes on anniversary of Vanniyar reservation agitation
content: Mr. Anbumani, accompanied by his supporters, paid tributes at Sithani and a few other places in Villupuram district

title: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah visits rain-affected areas in Kalaburagi, interacts with distressed farmers who reported crop loss
content: The Chief Minister inspected the 27.23-acre farm land belonging to farmers Channabasappa and Suryakant (Survey No. 50), where a tur crop had been completely destroyed

title: Kerala HC orders probe into ‘reduced weight’ of gold-cladded Dwarapalaka idols at Sabarimala temple
content: The weight of the idols reduced by 4kg. Court seeks to know why the idols’ weight was not checked in 2019 prior to their reinstallation at the temple

title: Union government releases first instalment of united grants to T.N. rural local bodies
content: The allocated grants are recommended and released in two instalments in a financial year, a release said

title: Delhi riots conspiracy case: Five years on, activists demand fair trial for Umar Khalid, others
content: At a public meet held at Mumbai Marathi Patrakar Sangh, speakers decried five years of ‘injustice’ in Delhi riots case

title: Waste collection, processing in Kerala has improved drastically post-Brahmapuram fire, Minister tells Assembly
content: Replying to a Calling Attention motion, M.B. Rajesh says collection and processing of non-biodegradable waste in Kerala had risen from 47% in March 2023 to 98% at present

title: Hyundai Motor India signs wage pact with its recognised union
content: The long-term wage settlement will be effective from April 1, 2024, through March 31, 2027, the company said in a statement.

title: Goa’s deep connect with classical music comes alive at  ‘Malhar and the Sea’ festival
content: The festival, held recently at ITC Grand by Arossim beach, showed how classical music is as much a part of the region’s cultural tapestry as Fado and folk music.

title: AIADMK leaders ‘satisfied’ with outcome of meeting with Amit Shah in New Delhi
content: A group of functionaries, who accompanied Mr. Palaniswami during his visit to New Delhi, claim there is “no confusion” between the AIADMK and BJP over issues such as the projection of the AIADMK general secretary as the Chief Minister candidate

title: Jairam Ramesh hits back at Centre over its rebuttal of his charges on Dhirauli coal mine project
content: As far as the second claim is concerned, the Forest Rights Act, 2006 includes not just individual forest rights but also community forest resource rights (CFR) and habitat rights of particularly vulnerable tribal groups (PVTGs), Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: Kalyana Karnataka benefited significantly after Article 371(J) was implemented: Minister
content: The Minister said that considering the backwardness of the region, the UPA government, under the leadership of veteran leader Mallikarjun Kharge, brought an amendment to Article 371, giving a special status to the region

title: Kerala Assembly: Health department blindsided by recurrence of amoebic meningoencephalitis cases, says Opposition Leader
content: Satheesan says Kerala government lacks a treatment protocol and remains clueless about the disease’s provenance and spread across the State

title: Madras HC dismisses case filed by DMDK leader L.K. Sudhish against order to refund ₹98.27 lakh to elderly widow
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan grant liberty to the couple to approach the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

title: Sikh leaders in Pakistan urge India to lift ban on pilgrims travelling to Guru Nanak’s shrine
content: The Central government has denied permission for Sikhs to cross into Pakistan for Guru Nanak’s birth anniversary, citing security concerns

title: Karnataka government releases ₹125 crore to newly-formed corporations in Bengaluru
content: The new corporations have been established under the Greater Bengaluru Administration Act, 2024 through a government notification issued on September 2, 2025.

title: Supreme Court reverses 2022 verdict on Haryana village common lands, restores proprietors’ rights
content: Allowing the plea seeking review of its own judgement, a Bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and K.V. Viswanathan set aside the 2022 verdict

title: Gourangalal Das to be India's new Envoy to South Korea
content: Das played a key role in the negotiations between India and China to rebuild their ties that came under severe strain following the over four-year-long eastern Ladakh border standoff

title: Indo-US research collaboration identifies cholesterol’s role in irreversible hair loss
content: The study uncovers an unrecognised role of cholesterol intermediates in governing hair follicle regeneration.

title: First consignment of Hilsa fish from Bangladesh reaches India
content: Bangladesh had recently approved the export of 1,200 tonnes of Hilsa to India for the festive season, with the shipment window fixed between September 16 and October 5

title: Ladki Bahin scheme won’t be scrapped; govt committed to empowering women: Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra will not prosper unless villages in the state register progress, he said. “It is not possible until the poor, labourers, and villages prosper,” he said

title: Five booked for assault on TNSTC bus staff in Salem; two held
content: The driver and conductor were assaulted by a girl’s family members after another passenger made obscene gestures at her and fled

title: Telangana CM says people with relatives in politics too will not be spared if engaged in drug activity
content: He said the drug menace was not confined to the city, but was creeping into municipalities and other areas calling for urgent steps to combat it

title: Patna High Court directs Congress to remove AI-generated video of PM Modi, his late mother
content: The court, while ordering immediate withdrawal of the video, has also issued notices to Rahul Gandhi, Facebook, Twitter and Google

title: Supreme Court steps in to give tigers a hand against poachers operating in the big cats’ heartland
content: The petition referred to media reports of poaching gangs in central India catering to clientele in Southeast Asian countries, including Myanmar, and providing illegal products like ‘bone glue’

title: 2008 Malegaon blast: Bombay HC adjourns hearing on appeal against acquittal over incomplete details
content: The seven accused acquitted in the case included former BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur and Lt Col Prasad Purohit.

title: Madhampatty Rangaraj’s catering firm alleges ₹12 crore contract loss due to Joy Crizildaa’s social media hashtags
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar decides to hear the case, along with an individual suit filed by Madhampatty Rangaraj to protect his personality rights, on September 24

title: Narendra Modi biopic ‘Maa Vande’: Malayalam actor Unni Mukundan to play the Prime Minister
content: Kranthi Kumar CH’s Narendra Modi biopic, Maa Vande, which will be released in multiple Indian languages, has some of the finest technicians on board

title: TPCC marks Telangana Merger Day in Hyderabad, slams BJP for celebrating it as ‘Liberation Day’
content: Mr. Goud pointed out that it was the Congress government that integrated Hyderabad into the Indian Union within four days in 1948 through ‘Operation Polo’

title: NHAI to pilot IoT-based lighting system on Chennai-Tiruchi highway for improved visibility
content: The contractor will create a mobile application that will be used by maintenance personnel, NHAI officials, and supervisors

title: Impact of U.S. tariffs, GST slab rejig: Kerala seeks supplementary grants, ‘extra borrowing limit’ of 0.5%
content: Seeking supplementary grants under Article 275 of the Constitution, Kerala asks 16th Finance Commission to ‘reassess’ State finances and resource needs for next five years when finalising its recommendations on vertical devolution and revenue deficit grants

title: Supreme Court asks CAQM, CPCB, State boards to come out with plan to deal with air pollution in three weeks
content: Supreme Court, however, granted six months for filling up promotional posts in State pollution control boards, CAQM and CPCB

title: Yellow Line of Namma Metro cuts peak-hour congestion by 37.5% on south Bengaluru roads
content: According to a Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) study reviewed by The Hindu, congestion on the stretch has fallen by 30.6% overall, including 37.5% during peak hours and 17% during non-peak hours on weekdays

title: Day after India-U.S. trade talks, PM Modi urges people to buy and sell local
content: PM says Armed Forces ‘brought Pakistan to its knees in the blink of an eye’ during Operation Sindoor; refers to viral video of a Jaish-e-Mohammad commander on destruction by Indian strikes on terror hideouts

title: Raleigh passes Mantle, ties Griffey with 55, 56
content: Seattle's Cal Raleigh broke Mickey Mantle's record for homers by a switch-hitter then tied Ken Griffey Jr. for most home runs in franchise history in the next at-bat.

title: Fever leap another hurdle, stay alive in G2 rout
content: The Fever proved their resilience yet again, proving they aren't done yet after a 77-60 throttling of the Dream on Tuesday to force a winner-take-all Game 3.

title: Storm halt Aces' 17-game win streak, force Game 3
content: The Storm handed the Aces their first loss since Aug. 2, rallying from a 14-point deficit in the second half Tuesday night to win Game 2 of their first-round series 86-83 and force a deciding Game 3 on Thursday in Las Vegas.

title: Eagles LT: Tush push chatter makes 'blood boil'
content: Eagles left tackle Jordan Mailata has had enough of the media narrative that his team won Sunday's Super Bowl rematch against the Chiefs because of the tush push.

title: Dodgers bullpen spoils Ohtani's 5 no-hit IP, 50th HR
content: Shohei Ohtani threw five no-hit innings Tuesday night against an imposing Phillies lineup before exiting as a pitcher, only to watch the Dodgers' bullpen implode again in a 9-6 loss.

title: NFL: Brady didn't violate rules in Raiders booth
content: Tom Brady did not violate any NFL rules by wearing a headset in the Raiders' coaching booth during Monday night's game, the NFL announced.

title: Source: Vikings RB Jones (hamstring) hits IR
content: The Vikings placed running back Aaron Jones on injured reserve Tuesday because of a hamstring injury, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Gators' Juluke gets 3 games for role in LSU scuffle
content: Florida suspended assistant coach Jabbar Juluke for three games for his role in an altercation before last Saturday's game against LSU.

title: 🏈 Fantasy pickups: Daniel Jones among options
content: Highlighting available signal-callers after an injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: An early look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: Arsenal show at Athletic that they possess the depth to win UCL
content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

title: Champions League recap: 10-man Madrid defeat Marseille, Juve draw with Dortmund
content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

title: The biggest success -- and biggest failure -- for all 30 MLB teams this season
content: Whether your favorite team is headed to October or headed home, all clubs have had something go right ... and wrong.

title: Four rivals, 13 days: Five things we learned from Yankees' key September stretch
content: New York went 7-5 against Houston, Toronto, Detroit and Boston. Did it teach us anything for October?

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

title: Rest-of-season rankings: Adams, Jones climb ranks; Jeanty drops
content: Eric Karabell updates his fantasy rankings at every position for the remainder of the season, including his top 100 overall.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Paige Bueckers receives Rookie of the Year award on Jennifer Hudson's show
content: The Dallas Wings star is the seventh former UConn player and 16th No. 1 overall draft pick to earn the honor.

title: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: More Baker magic, Mack hurt in Chargers win
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Crawford takes over super middleweight; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford's win over Canelo Alvarez reshapes the 168-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Francisco Lindor homers shortly after wife, Katia, performs national anthem on violin
content: Katia Lindor minored in music at St. Mary's University in Texas and is a classically trained violinist.

title: Ovechkin cereal hits shelves with nods to Capitals star's career
content: 'Ovi's Great Crunch' will be available exclusively at Giant Food stores in the Washington, D.C., area.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Kobbie Mainoo wanted by Newcastle
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is a January target for Newcastle United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
content: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

title: 'No interference ...': Rajnath on Op Sindoor pause; big warning for Pak
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the Indian Army's bravery, citing a Jaish-e-Mohammed commander's admission about the devastation caused by Operation Sindoor, which targeted Masood Azhar's family. PM Modi echoed this, highlighting the operation's success in bringing Pakistan to its knees and emphasizing India's strengthened stance against terrorism.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
content: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: 'Navalny poisoned': Wife says labs reveal foul play; claims Putin responsible
content: Yulia Navalnaya, wife of Alexei Navalny, alleges that independent lab tests confirm he was poisoned while in prison. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024. The labs, located in two countries, concluded that Navalny was killed by poisoning. Navalny previously survived a poisoning attempt in 2020.

title: Amazon CEO’s warning: Company’s culture may be at risk; needs a reset
content: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: Pakistan vs UAE in doubt? ACC social media post creates further chaos
content: Tensions escalate within the Pakistan camp ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against UAE, as the ACC unexpectedly deleted its social media post promoting the game, raising concerns about Pakistan's participation.

title: 'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
content: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: 'Our soldiers brought Pak to its knees': PM Modi reacts to JeM commander's video; hails Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday in Madhya Pradesh, lauded Operation Sindoor's success, citing a Jaish-e-Muhammed commander's video confession. The commander admitted the operation devastated Maulana Masood Azhar's family and JeM's Bahawalpur headquarters on May 7. Modi asserted that this "new India" fears no threats and strikes within enemy territory, prioritizing national security after Pakistani terrorists harmed Indian citizens.

title: Tim Cook said no to Apple until Steve Jobs gave him 'reason’ to say yes
content: In 1998, Tim Cook, then an executive at Compaq, repeatedly declined offers to join struggling Apple. A brief meeting with Steve Jobs altered Cook's perspective. Impressed by Jobs' vision and consumer-centric approach, Cook ignored advice against the move and joined Apple as head of worldwide operations, recognizing it as a lifetime opportunity.

title: Sebi leases Rs 7 lakh/month luxury flat for chairman - check details here
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has leased a luxurious five-bedroom apartment in Mumbai's Prabhadevi for its chairman, Tuhin Kanta Pandey, at a monthly rent of Rs 7 lakh. The three-year lease includes a 3,000 sq. ft. apartment with four car parks and a 5% annual rent escalation, aligning with Sebi's policy for leased accommodations.

title: The void between India and Pakistan is not just in skills, but also the way they train
content: Watching India and Pakistan train in Dubai highlighted the gulf between the two sides. India’s discipline, punctuality and structured sessions contrasted starkly with Pakistan’s disorganised approach. While Indian batters endured rigorous drills under coaches, Pakistan turned to casual football and trial-and-error practice — mirroring their struggles on the field.

title: 'Priyanka Chopra had bad skin, she is big-boned': Prahlad Kakkar lauds actress
content: Priyanka Chopra's journey from a pageant winner to a Bollywood star and then to Hollywood is lauded by adman Prahlad Kakkar. He reveals that she overcame disadvantages like her complexion and build with hard work and determination. Kakkar praises her ambition, focus, and dignity, especially regarding her personal life, highlighting her resilience in restarting her career in a new industry.

title: Elon Musk shakes up xAI; 500 laid off, promotes 20-year-old student to lead Grok
content: Following extensive layoffs at xAI, a University of Pennsylvania student, Diego Pasini, now leads the crucial data annotation team responsible for training the Grok AI chatbot. This appointment, occurring after the departure of experienced staff, has led to further workforce reductions and new performance evaluation protocols. Pasini's rapid rise followed supportive comments about Elon Musk and a company hackathon win.

title: ‘Come to Vizag’: Andhra IT minister Nara Lokesh invites BlackBuck CEO Rajesh Yabaji
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh extended an invitation to BlackBuck's CEO Rajesh Yabaji to relocate the company to Visakhapatnam, following Yabaji's announcement of leaving Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road due to severe commuting issues. This move has ignited concerns within Bengaluru's IT sector regarding governance and infrastructure, prompting calls for government intervention to address deteriorating road conditions and public utilities.

title: PM Modi turns 75: Trump dials 'friend', Meloni posts selfie; wishes pour in
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with global leaders extending their heartfelt wishes, acknowledging his leadership and India's growing global influence. US President Donald Trump, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lauded PM Modi's friendship and vision. Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also conveyed their greetings, emphasising strong bilateral ties.

title: 'Why you asking for my wife's number': Foreign tourist confronts man in Amritsar - watch
content: A video from Amritsar shows a foreign tourist confronting a local man for inappropriately asking his wife for her phone number. The tourist questioned the man's behavior, deeming it "strange." Social media users expressed frustration, sharing similar experiences of harassment faced by women in India. One user recounted incidents of strangers incessantly requesting photos with his girlfriend.

title: 'Decided not to play': How Vaishali's Chennai nightmare helped her win Grand Swiss
content: Grandmaster R Vaishali secured her spot in the Women’s Candidates Tournament 2026 by winning the Women’s Grand Swiss in Samarkand. This victory came after a challenging experience at the Chennai Grand Masters, where she faced a series of losses. Ironically, her lowered rating from the Chennai tournament inadvertently contributed to her Grand Swiss win due to tie-break calculations.

title: GST rate cuts: FM says reforms to inject Rs 2L cr; claims 'people will have cash in hand'
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that GST rate cuts, effective September 22, are expected to inject Rs 2 lakh crore into the economy. Post-reform, most items have shifted to lower tax brackets. Companies are reportedly reducing rates, passing benefits to consumers.

title: 'Not a fan': Dana White makes blunt confession about WWE
content: UFC President Dana White reiterated his disinterest in WWE in 2025. He acknowledged the athleticism of WWE performers, praising Logan Paul. White emphasized the difference between UFC's real combat and WWE's scripted entertainment. He recalled his disagreement with Lawrence Epstein's crossover fan idea from 2023. White maintains his focus remains solely on the fight game.

title: ‘Severe pain’: India’s exports to US fall drastically on Trump’s 50% tariffs; check details
content: India's exports to the US have been declining for three consecutive months, with August experiencing a significant 16.3% drop due to increased tariffs imposed by the US. The impact is uneven, heavily affecting sectors like apparel and gems, potentially leading to substantial export losses and job cuts.

title: Hands tied, lashed with leather belt, kicked: Andhra woman tortured by husband
content: Andhra Pradesh police are searching for Balraju, who is accused of tying his first wife, Bhagyamma, to a pole and assaulting her in Prakasam district on September 13. The incident stemmed from Balraju's suspicion of infidelity and Bhagyamma's refusal to provide money for his medical treatment, as she is the sole caretaker of their four children.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: AAP slams Suryakumar Yadav, BCCI
content: The Aam Aadmi Party has escalated the India-Pakistan handshake controversy, with leader Saurabh Bharadwaj challenging Suryakumar Yadav and the BCCI. Bharadwaj urged them to donate match earnings to the Pahalgam terror attack victims' widows.

title: 'Action will be taken': IPL chairman on PCB's complaint; clarifies ICC will review
content: Following a handshake controversy during the Asia Cup clash, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) lodged a complaint against match referee Andy Pycroft, requesting his removal. While the ICC rejected the initial appeal, Pycroft has been "rested" for Pakistan's upcoming match.

title: 'Woh toh dabayenge na': Dhanashree Verma reacts to rumours of cheating Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma, following her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, addresses rumors of infidelity on the reality show 'Rise And Fall.' She dismisses divorce gossip as fabricated and hints at revealing her side of the story, suggesting Chahal fears her speaking out. Dhanashree also declares she's currently uninterested in finding love, humorously comparing herself to Salman Khan.

title: Childless woman burnt alive on cow dung pile; in-laws attack cops during cremation attempt
content: In a shocking incident in Alwar's Deeg district, Sarla Devi was allegedly burnt alive by her in-laws due to years of harassment for being childless. When police intervened to investigate, they were attacked by villagers attempting to cremate the body.

title: Patna high court orders Congress to remove AI video on PM Modi’s mother
content: Patna High Court has ordered Congress to remove an AI-generated video from social media platforms featuring PM Modi and his late mother, Heeraben Modi. The video, shared by Bihar Congress, depicted Modi's mother criticizing his politics, sparking outrage from BJP leaders who condemned it as disrespectful and shameful.

title: Agra: Elderly couple die as e-scooter on charge catches fire; granddaughter survives
content: In a tragic incident in Agra, an elderly couple died in a fire caused by an e-scooter that was charging indoors. Their 14-year-old granddaughter escaped to alert her parents. The victims, aged 95 and 85, were sleeping on the ground floor when the scooter's battery exploded. The son alleges negligence by the manufacturer, as the battery was still under warranty.

title: How much revenue will Pakistan lose if they pull out of the Asia Cup?
content: Pakistan's threat to withdraw from the Asia Cup over a referee dispute could cost them millions in revenue, potentially jeopardising their financial stability within the Asian Cricket Council. This potential decision, driven by PCB chief Naqvi's criticism of the match referee, risks a significant loss from broadcast deals and sponsorships.

title: Trump ramps up attacks on NYT after $15bn lawsuit
content: Donald Trump has launched a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing the newspaper of a long-standing smear campaign. Filed in Florida, the suit targets several reporters, the paper, and its publisher, citing articles and a book as evidence of malicious defamation.

title: Study abroad: Indian students can study in Germany without visa fee; here's how
content: Indian students planning short-term academic programs in Germany can now avail of gratis visas, eliminating the usual visa fees and making international education more accessible. This initiative promotes academic mobility, cultural exchange, and research collaboration. With world-class universities, affordable tuition, and modernized visa processes, Germany continues to emerge as a top destination, attracting tens of thousands of Indian students annually.

title: UAE: HSBC sets up shop in Dubai with region's first wealth centre
content: HSBC has launched a wealth centre in Dubai to tap into the UAE's growing affluent market, amidst a historic influx of millionaires. The centre offers exclusive services for high-net-worth clients and reflects HSBC’s long-term strategy in the region. As the UAE attracts investors from across the globe, HSBC plans further expansion, considering Abu Dhabi as a future location.

title: 'Death-trap roads': BlackBuck CEO Rajesh Yabaji exits Bengaluru
content: BlackBuck, an online trucking platform, is relocating from its Bellandur office due to severe commuting difficulties caused by poor road infrastructure. This decision highlights the urgent need for government intervention, as other IT companies express similar concerns. Despite promises of road development and allocated funds, residents continue to face pothole-ridden roads and civic apathy, leading to protests and frustration.

title: Devin Haney lawsuit: From $350k gift dispute to renewed battle
content: Boxer Devin Haney and Leena Sayed are in court again. Haney has filed a new lawsuit against his ex-fiancée. He wants back luxury gifts worth $350,000. Haney claims these were conditional gifts. He says they were given with the promise of marriage. This follows a previous lawsuit by Haney. He had accused Sayed of defamation and extortion.

title: UPI upgrade! Daily transaction raised to Rs 5L for select categories - check who benefits
content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has increased UPI transaction limits for specific categories, effective September 15. Tax payments, government e-marketplaces, and B2B transactions now have a Rs 5 lakh per-transaction limit. Insurance premiums and capital markets gain a Rs 10 lakh daily limit, while peer-to-peer payments remain unchanged.

title: Rijiju takes veiled swipe after Pak admits India rejected mediation; asks will people apologise?
content: Kiren Rijiju inquired if critics of India's policy on third-party mediation would apologize. This follows Pakistan's acknowledgement that India rejected external involvement during Operation Sindoor. Mohammad Ishaq Dar confirmed India's stance, contradicting claims of US-brokered peace. India maintains that discussions with Pakistan should remain bilateral.

title: ‘Quiet!’: Trump snaps at Australian reporter over wealth question - watch
content: Donald Trump clashed with an Australian journalist over his business dealings as president, accusing him of "hurting Australia" and threatening to complain to Anthony Albanese. The confrontation confirmed a planned meeting between Trump and Albanese at the UN General Assembly.

title: Can’t cook dal on my own, but I can be the 'namak': Chirag Paswan on Bihar CM bid
content: Chirag Paswan, LJP (Ram Vilas) chief, has dismissed any ambition for Bihar's CM post in 2025, setting his sights on 2030 and 2035. He affirmed his party's commitment to strengthening the NDA alliance and highlighted their potential to significantly boost NDA candidates' vote share in the upcoming assembly polls. Paswan also ruled out any alliance with Prashant Kishor's party.

title: Adin Ross probe: From insider trading allegations to AGA investigation
content: Popular streamer Adin Ross is reportedly under scrutiny by the American Gaming Association following a last-minute, million-dollar bet change during the Canelo Alvarez vs. Terence Crawford fight. Allegations of potential insider trading ignoring gambling regulations have surfaced after Ross abruptly switched his wager based on a mysterious phone call he received live on stream.

title: Infant among 3 family members killed in Mandi landslide, HP monsoon toll 417
content: A devastating landslide in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district claimed three lives, including an infant, after heavy rains caused a house collapse in Baragata village. While two family members were rescued alive, others perished. This tragedy follows another recent landslide in Sundernagar that killed seven. The State Disaster Management Authority reports the monsoon death toll has reached 417.

title: Woman stabbed twice, chants shlokas, plays dead; ex-driver & gang loots home
content: In Bengaluru, a former driver orchestrated a robbery at his ex-employer's house, targeting valuables with two accomplices. The elderly woman was brutally stabbed when she couldn't provide the keys, but she played dead to deter the assailants. After the robbers ransacked the house and left, the woman bravely alerted neighbors, leading to the capture of one suspect.

title: Andhra Pradesh means business, come and experience, Nara Lokesh calls upon entrepreneurs
content: Nara Lokesh further said Andhra Pradesh was leading India’s Quantum Technology revolution by developing a Quantum Valley in Amaravati

title: More than half of electorate in most States may not have to give any document in SIR: ECI officials
content: The Election Commission will soon decide on the date to roll out special intensive revision pan-India, and the exercise to clean up the voter list across States may take place before the end of the year, says an official

title: PM-KUSUM tenders row: Kerala government’s approval was not sought, says Power Minister in Assembly
content: To a question by UDF MLAs as to whether the then Anert CEO, Narendranath Veluri, had invited tenders worth ₹240 crore when he did not have the authority to exceed ₹5 crore, Krishnankutty says a department-level investigation was in progress

title: Farmer trampled to death by wild elephant in Erode’s Kadambur hills
content: The incident has shocked the local community and underscored the recurring problem of elephant incursions in the Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve

title: T.N. Governor, CM Stalin wish PM Modi on his birthday
content: “The people of Tamil Nadu extend the warmest greetings to Mr. Modi on his 75th birthday, wishing him a healthy long life,” Raj Bhavan Tamil Nadu posted on X

title: Don't worry about us, says HC; dismisses plea against 'Jolly LLB 3' movie
content: The filmmakers informed the Bench that a similar plea against the movie was filed before the Allahabad High Court, and the same was dismissed

title: Kerala Assembly: Govt promises action in general hospital medical negligence case, free care to patient
content: Replying to submission by V.D. Satheesan, Veena George says top-level panel of government doctors is exploring whether ‘guide wire’ could be extricated from the patient without causing further medical complications

title: Rajnath Singh says India will not ‘bow’ to any country; draws parallel between Telangana armed struggle and Operation Sindoor
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh was the chief guest at the Telangana/Hyderabad Liberation Day celebrations held at Parade Grounds in Secunderabad

title: Doctors’ association to hold one-day strike on September 18, opposing registration of homoeopathy practitioners with MMC
content: “It must be noted that the issue is currently sub judice, and the final decision of the Bombay High Court is still awaited,” IMA State President, Santosh Kadam, said

title: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar will become country's EV capital: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis
content: CM Devendra Fadnavis was speaking at the Marathwada Mukti Sangram memorial at Siddharth Garden in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar

title: Principal shot dead by bike-borne assailants in U.P.'s Ballia, woman teacher injured
content: Three motorcycle-borne assailants allegedly tried to snatch the principal’s gold chain and opened fire when he resisted

title: NIA raids in Telangana in connection with Vizianagaram ISIS terror conspiracy crackdown
content: The case was initiated by the Vizianagaram police following the arrest of another accused Siraj-ur-Rahman in July 2025, who was found to be in possession of chemical substances used in the making of IEDs

title: India clears four ships for EU-sanctioned Nayara’s domestic fuel supply; dollar trade restrictions persist
content: The shipping arrangement now in place is set to help tide over the surge in demand anticipated in the ensuing festival season

title: Rejection of plea for house repair was a mistake, says Suresh Gopi
content: Union Minister hits back at critics, says denial of one request can’t be used to ‘extinguish this fireball’

title: Kerala Assembly: Government allows UDF’s demand for adjournment debate on amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: Speaker A N Shamseer told the House that Health Minister Veena George has assented to the Opposition to set aside usual business for an extended debate on the subject. He said the adjournment debate will commence at 12 noon

title: Villagers oppose Adani’s cement plant in Kalyan, raise environmental and health concerns
content: The ₹1400 crores worth cement grinding plant could be the second project of the Adani group that is facing opposition in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) region after the Dharavi redevelopment project

title: Kerala Assembly LIVE updates: House debates adjournment motion on amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: The 14th session of the 15th Kerala Assembly commenced on Monday. Tempers ran high in the Assembly on Tuesday as heated confrontations erupted over the mounting allegations of police excesses across the State.

title: NAFED must coordinate with Maharashtra Govt on onion market decisions: Minister Jaykumar Rawal
content: The NAFED had earlier indicated it would release stored onions into the market if prices went above ₹30 per kg, Mr. Rawal said

title: Kerala Assembly: UDF legislators enter second day of sit-in protest in House
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan had announced the indefinite strike during an adjournment debate on police highhandedness in Assembly on Tuesday

title: Bengal SSC uploads model answers for teacher recruitment exam
content: SSC chairman Siddhartha Majumdar said the candidates can challenge the model answers, which will be evaluated by experts

title: ED arrests former MUDA commissioner Dinesh Kumar in Bengaluru
content: According to sources, two residential premises in Bengaluru connected to Mr. Dinesh Kumar were searched under the PMLA 2002

title: President Murmu greets PM Modi on birthday, says he instilled culture of achieving great goals
content: PM Modi himself is travelling to Dhar in Madhya Pradesh to kick off a nationwide campaign focusing on women and children health and nutrition

title: Residents begin vacating Chander Kunj Army Towers in Kochi after AWHO credits ₹2.97-crore advance rent to escrow account
content: District Collector directs financial officer to disburse amount to individual bank accounts of apartment owners

title: NEET qualifiers, parents meet Chief Secretary on ‘local candidate’ status
content: The amendment was upheld by the Supreme Court on September 1 with a ruling that the State Government is competent to frame their own rules for providing reservations in medical admissions

title: Temporary suspension of sanitary waste collection creates backlog of 3,200 orders in Kochi Corporation
content: Waste collection was stalled after an incinerator was shut down for maintenance on September 1. Collection set to resume from Wednesday (September 17)

title: Dr. Ramdas Pai turns 90: A tribute to the architect of modern Manipal
content: On his 90th birthday, Dr. Sudarshan Ballal recalls Dr. Ramdas Pai’s leadership that transformed Manipal into a hub of education and healthcare

title: The birthplace of several housing colonies in Chennai
content: The Gopalapuram Co-Operative Housing Society building may hold within it the story of the development of not just one, but as many as five housing developments in the city

title: Vaishno Devi pilgrimage resumes after 3-week halt
content: Pilgrims are advised to carry valid identification, follow designated pathways and cooperate with on-ground staff, the officials said, adding Radio Frequency Identity Card (RFID)-based tracking remains mandatory for transparency and traceability.

title: The hidden human cost of Artificial Intelligence
content: AI’s efficiency and accuracy are built on the invisible labour of low-paid workers in developing countries. From data labelling to content moderation, ‘ghost workers’ face exploitation, insecurity, and mental health risks.

title: India rejects third-party mediation on bilateral issues: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Dar
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan soared after terrorists killed 26 people, mostly civilians, in Jammu and Kashmir’s Pahalgam on April 22

title: Finance Ministry’s financial inclusion push sees 61 lakh new bank accounts, 2.6 crore insurance enrolments so far
content: Launched on July 1, 2025, the campaign was conducted by the Department of Financial Services with an aim to include every last person in the country under financial inclusion schemes.

title: Rains LIVE: Fresh rains leave trail of destruction in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand
content: Jammu and Kashmir Congress said the Union territory has suffered a “colossal damage” due to heavy rains and floods

title: Rajasthan surpasses target for millet outlets in rural areas
content: Rajasthan Government exceeds target, establishes 152 millet outlets to promote nutritious and sustainable food options in rural areas

title: Anti-climax of Pudukottai Lok Sabha bye-election in 1995 when Thirunavukkarasar was a ‘common candidate’
content: The Pudukottai episode, according to Mr. Thirunavukkarasar, had caused a considerable gap between him and Karunanidhi. However, three years later, he and Karunanidhi patched up and the former went on to become an MP from the same constituency.

title: TNSTC buses display ‘Be kind to Animal’ slogan
content: TNSTC officials said that bright blue colour has been selected for these stickers to enhance the readability among commuters and passersby

title: A failed attempt of train sabotage by railway employees in Madras 60 years ago
content: According to an article by S. Nagalingam, Superintendent of Police, Special Branch, CID, Madras in the October-December 1965 edition of The Madras Police Journal, all the three accused were found guilty.

title: Tripura Government cancels licence of controversial Bar Club in Agartala
content: West Tripura District Magistrate said there was no permission given for organising a DJ party in the bar adjacent to the Rabindra Bhavan, which is attributed as a cultural landmark in Agartala city

title: Former CM Naveen Patnaik expresses deep anguish over sexual assault on women in Odisha
content: The five-time Chief Minister condemns gang rape near Puri temple and criticises BJP’s failure to ensure women’s safety

title: Maoists offer to lay down arms in a letter; verifying, says Chhattisgarh Government
content: A purported letter from the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) offers to give up arms and seeks peace talks with the government amid conditions

title: Constitutional, religious concerns remain unaddressed in Supreme Court’s interim order: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: Muttahida Majlis-e-Ulema demanded that the top court urgently take up the matter for a final hearing and safeguard the constitutional and religious rights of Muslims

title: Ahmednagar railway station renamed Ahilyanagar
content: Ahmednagar railway station renamed Ahilyanagar to Honour Lokmata Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar, in sync with district name

title: Rajasthan High Court accepts ACB’s closure report in government toppling case
content: The  Anti-Corruption Bureau report stated that there was no evidence of bribery, horse-trading, or political conspiracy in the intercepted phone calls which formed the basis of the case

title: Madhya Pradesh woman constable beaten to death by husband with baseball bat
content: The Police official says the accused, Virendra Saket, fled the spot after the alleged crime and is currently on the run

title: Court denies bail to two accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq’s assassination case
content: Bail applications of the accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq assassination dismissed by TADA Court; accused avoided law enforcement for years

title: Apple stocks dumped in ditches, as key highway remains closed for third week in Kashmir
content: Officials said a 300-metre patch in Udhampur was proving to be a major challenge for the authorities. The area has witnessed landslips and land subsidence in the past three weeks

title: After Indore, patients allege rat bites at Jabalpur medical college; probe launched
content: Jabalpur Collector Raghvendra Singh said that the district administration has issued notices to hospital authorities, seeking a status report on the incident within three days

title: "If It's A Woman, You Can Give Bail," BMW Crash Accused Tells Court
content: The death of a senior finance ministry official in a BMW crash with a two-wheeler in Delhi last week is unfortunate but one cannot overlook that at least 5,000 accidents are also reported across the country every year, the court was told.

title: "A Source Of Inspiration": Italy's PM Giorgia Meloni Wishes PM Modi On 75th Birthday
content: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni on Wednesday extended birthday greetings to her Indian counterpart, Narendra Modi, who turned 75.

title: PM Modi Birthday Live Updates | On 75th Birthday, PM Modi Launches 'Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar' Campaign
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is celebrating his 75th birthday today. He was born on September 17, 1950 in Vadnagar, a small town in North Gujarat's Mehsana district.

title: Key Accused Behind NEET Aspirant's Murder In UP Arrested After Encounter
content: The Uttar Police has arrested one of the accused, in Gorakhpur NEET student murder case and taken two others in custody. Accused Rahim was arrested following an encounter in Kushinagar.

title: Missed ITR Deadline? What Happens Next And How You Can Still Pay
content: The government moved the ITR deadline from September 15 to September 16, 2025. Those who missed even this extended timeline still have an opportunity to file their returns.

title: Botox And Beards In Afghanistan: Cosmetic Surgery Flourishes Under Taliban Rule
content: Decked out with fake crystal chandeliers and velvet sofas, cosmetic surgery clinics in Afghanistan's capital are a world away from the austerity of Taliban rule, where Botox, lip filler, and hair transplants reign.

title: 1,300 Gifts To PM Modi, Including Ram Temple Model, Up For E-Auction
content: Over 1,300 items gifted to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, including an exquisitely crafted statue of Goddess Bhavani, an Ayodhya Ram Temple model and sporting memorabilia from the 2024 Paralympic Games, have been put up for an e-auction.

title: Married Woman Allegedly Killed Over Infertility In Rajasthan, Cops Recover Half-Burnt Body
content: A married woman was allegedly killed by her in-laws in Rajasthan's Deeg district for not being able to bear children.

title: What Charlie Kirk Murder Suspect Tyler Robinson's Mother Told Police
content: Accused Tyler Robinson's mother said he was becoming more liberal in his political views, especially supportive of LGBTQ+ rights.

title: What To know About The Hunt For Suspect In Charlie Kirk's Killing
content: Authorities have shared their most detailed account yet of the investigation set off by the killing of American conservative activist Charlie Kirk, which concluded with a suspect surrendering to police.

title: Villagers Carry Unwell Man On Shoulders For 6 Km To Reach Ambulance
content: An elderly tribal man suffering from high fever was carried by community members on their shoulders for over six km, taking six hours through dense forest in Kerala's Idukki district, to the nearest medical facility.

title: What Elon Musk Said To INOX's Siddharth Jain On Purchase Of 1st Tesla
content: Siddharth Jain, Executive Director of the INOX Group, on Monday took delivery of what he described as "India Inc's first Tesla."

title: Daily Beast Pulls Story Linking Melania Trump To Jeffrey Epstein, Issues Apology
content: The Daily Beast has issued an apology to US First Lady Melania Trump after it published an article claiming that she was introduced to her husband, President Donald Trump, through convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: "No Cluster Of" Brain-Eating Amoeba Cases, Clarifies Kerala Health Minister
content: Kerala's health authorities have issued a high alert after a significant spike in cases of Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM), a deadly brain infection caused by the "brain-eating amoeba" (Naegleria fowleri).

title: King Charles III To Welcome Trump With State Banquet, Carriage Ride At Windsor Castle
content: Donald Trump said Tuesday after arriving in London that he loved being back in the United Kingdom, calling it a "very special place." Asked if he had a message for Charles, he said the king was a longtime friend of his and well-respected.

title: TikTok, Trade, Taiwan Top Agenda For Call Between Trump, Xi
content: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will have plenty to discuss this week in their first conversation since June, with TikTok, Boeing planes, rare earth magnets and Taiwan among top items for negotiation.

title: Rs 67,000 In 2 Months: Engineer Earns More On X Than "Campus Placement"
content: A 21-year-old engineer has claimed that he earns a substantial income just by posting regularly on social media platform X (formerly Twitter). The engineer, Kanav, shared a detailed breakdown of his earnings in a thread.

title: "Jaish Terrorists Exposed Pakistan": PM Praises Op Sindoor On 75th Birthday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday reiterated that India is not afraid of nuclear threats, as he hailed the success of 'Operation Sindoor' that was carried out in retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 2 Maharashtra Teens Die In Accident, Protesters Garland Potholes In Nashik
content: Hemant Patil and Mahendra Fating, both 19, died in road accidents after their bike skidded due to potholes.
